name: The Day of the Dead Sweatshirt
description:
This sweatshirt draws its inspiration from the beautifully decorated clay skulls associated with Mexico's Day of the Dead festival. This slim-cut, super-comfortable sweatshirt is available in navy blue. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: "I don't like electronic music" Hoodie
description:
As retorts go, "I don't like you" is just a step above "Your mum." This design glows in the dark! One minute in normal light and it glows in the dark for 8-10 minutes. In UV light it glows straight away. This supremely comfortable hoodie is available in navy blue. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: Lt Rushton the Skeleton Soldier
description:
Meet Lieutenant Rushton, 1892-1917. This skeleton soldier's proud handlebar moustache shines as bright as his gold buttons. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: Oi, Noah! Hoodie
description:
Everyone likes dinosaurs. Everyone except Noah. This design is featured in the video for Patrick Stump's "Spotlight (Oh Nostalgia)"! Screen grab here. This hoodie is available in kelly green. Sally Can't Dance only uses hoodies which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: "I don't like broccoli!" Hoodie
description:
Broccoli's rubbish. It tastes nasty, smells horrible and looks like a freakish, midget tree. Also, it said terrible things about your mum. Terrible, terrible things. This supremely comfortable hoodie is available in Kelly Green. Sally Can't Dance only uses hoodies which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: Frida & Diego Sweatshirt
description:
Named for Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera, this skeletal couple are lovers from beyond the grave. You can read all about how they came to be here. This slim-cut, super-comfortable sweatshirt is available in black. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: RaveApe Sweatshirt
description:
RaveApe might look a bit weird but you'd look odd too if you'd been dancing for 79 hours straight. RaveApe's face also glows in the dark! One minute in normal light and he'll glow in the dark for 8-10 minutes. In UV light, he glows straight away! This slim-cut, super-comfortable sweatshirt is available in black. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: Hang the DJ
description:
We’ve all wasted precious hours of our lives in bad clubs with awful DJs – we at Sally Can’t Dance don’t usually endorse capital punishment, but The Smiths might’ve been onto something… This T-shirt comes in denim blue in men's sizes and royal blue for women's sizes. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: RaveApe
description:

One minute in normal light and he'll glow in the dark for 8-10 minutes. In UV light, he glows straight away! This T-shirt is available in black. name: "I miss grunge."
description:
Remember the days when jeans were baggy and torn, hair was unstyled and unkempt and "dancing" consisted of moshing and head-banging? Those were the days. This T-shirt is available in white. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.

name: Just a routine procedure...
description:
Meet Dr. Siegfried Ryan. At the tender age of 14, Siegfried taught himself heart surgery, using little more than masking tape and power tools. After a series of semi-successful operations, he learnt the hard way that there’s more to surgery than just opening them up. Sally Can't Dance only uses T-shirts which are 100% pre-shrunk cotton, and are completely environmentally-friendly and ethically-produced, certified by the Fair Wear Foundation.
